intro: Catasetum × splendens var. revolutum, commonly known as the curled lip orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with a unique, curled lip that resembles a lip curl, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its inflorescence consists of multiple fragrant, colorful flowers that bloom in spring or early summer. The botanical features of this orchid make it a popular choice for both horticultural collections and botanical research.
